reviewText:
Early Access Review

Note: Copy provided by the developer

Bolt Riley (Episode 1) is a very short point and click adventure in early access, telling a funny quirky story. The tutorial is implemented in the intro sequence, introducing the way on how to play. It has full voice acting (narrator and dialogues) enabled. Dialogues can be skipped at any time. There is an interesting feature available, called inspiration"
date: don’t want to talk about it in detail
recommended: just mention it. ;-)\n\nThe puzzles are almost logical and very funny. You can save your progress all the time. The control interface (item interaction/handling) needs some adjustment. The graphics is really simple and functional
hoursPlayed: it is a bit rough around the edges and there is room for improvement. So let’s see how it turns out in the end. But please don’t get me wrong

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Yo so what’s up Rasta’s this here be Steamified featuring a game for all yo reggae needs with Adventure Mob and Corbomite Games’s Bolt Riley: A Reggae Adventure. It’s a real pleasure son. I find it a little bit on the funny side man that an Israeli company is the one to create an adventure reggae anthem. This is just the first chapter of what is expected to be a two part game. I wish it were a little longer if the other chapter is as short in game play as what this one is because I quite enjoyed this chapter until it came to an abrupt end.

I actually thought that they held to the true side of reggae. It’s definitely an interesting concept for the game and it suckered me in more quickly than what most point and click adventure games have done lately. As a fan of reggae and the West Indies cricket team the subject matter was very enjoyable. The first chapter tells the story of Bolt Riley, the lead character in the game and the one that the player controls, and how he ascended to become a reggae superstar. It’s a cute charming story.

I liked that you could save your progress at any time. However, given that the gameplay can be finished in a little over an hour it makes for a perfectly fine one sitting game. The puzzles are for the most part logical and straight forward enough so one shouldn’t keep you guessing for too long. The music was quite nice. The graphics while simple suited the game very well.

Unfortunately, there were quite a few bugs in the game. Two of my bugbears involve the voice acting. The first is the fact that there was never any intention at mirroring the lip syncing of the characters to the voice acting. The second is if you ever wanted to skip some dialogue, which you can by pressing on the mouse you’ll still get the entire animation – without voice – until the animation is finished. That was more than a little irritating.

Given how short it is I would advise that it’s not quite worth the standard $9.99 asking price unless you’re a big fan of reggae and point and click adventures. However, it is one to watch for when it goes on a decent sale.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A Jamaican Reggae Point & Click Adventurehttps://youtu.be/n-lfihZHgyY
+ Some nice Reggae music that plays throughout the game
+ Lot so dialogue options
+ A pretty unique setting taking place in Jamaica with Jamaican accented voice actors

- The mouth animations on the characters seem to move far too much even when they are not saying much at all
- It can be pretty easy to get stuck without a guide, took me quite a while to figure out the first real puzzle
- I felt like some of the dialogue was somewhat odd and out of place.... near the beginning the Narrator says in a slow deep voice: And then he noticed there really is a piece of gum holding the clamper to the bell...WOW that was cool I really love the first time things happen"    I was just like what?????
- I was expecting to hear some reggae songs with lyrics
date: but was pretty disappointed as it mainly just seems like instrumental background melodies\n- it may just be me
recommended: but I found it hard to find anything likable about many of the characters"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It would be in my best interest to give a glowing review since I want to see this game completed but I need to be honest about the progress made so far. I do realise this game is considered Early Access and I know the budget for this game is pretty small, and you should keep that in mind too (if you end up reading the in-depth review linked below), but ultimately, is it something I would recommend to my friends or the gaming public in its current state? Considering the artwork still needs some touching up, bugs were encountered way too frequently, the UI needs fixing and the first chapter is way too short, probably not. I'm hoping that Adventure Mob will eventually prove me wrong though, as I really want this game to succeed.

http://www.choicestgames.com/2016/04/bolt-riley-reggae-adventure-chapter-1.html
